discussion_comments.comment_body: If the tests need build, it should be in prod test.

@@ -60,6 +60,9 @@ jobs:
       - name: Install Dependencies
         run: yarn install --immutable
 
+      - name: Build Package
+        run: yarn build --clean
discussion_comments.comment_body:
Aha! So _that's_ why there was some commented out stuff with an `isProduction` variable in the test before! I had not made the connection that "production" tests were ones where `yarn build` had been run.

Change made; should be ready for re-review.

commented_code:
- "macos-latest"
           - "windows-latest"
         node:
-          - "19"
-          - "18"
+          # Latest even version
+          - "20"
+          # Minimal version for development
           - "16"
         include:
-          # only enable coverage on the fastest job
           - os: "ubuntu-latest"
+            # Pick a version that is fast (normally highest LTS version)
             node: "18"
             ENABLE_CODE_COVERAGE: true
             FULL_TEST: true
             CHECK_TEST_PARSERS: true
-        exclude:
-          - os: "macos-latest"
-            node: "19"
-          - os: "windows-latest"
-            node: "19"
+          # Versions not tested on linux, normally only even versions
+          # If latest version is an odd number, it can be listed bellow too
+          # - os: "ubuntu-latest"
+          #   node: "20"
     env:
       ENABLE_CODE_COVERAGE: ${{ matrix.ENABLE_CODE_COVERAGE }}
       FULL_TEST: ${{ matrix.FULL_TEST }}
       CHECK_TEST_PARSERS: ${{ matrix.CHECK_TEST_PARSERS }}
-    name: Node.js ${{ matrix.node }} on ${{ matrix.os }}
+    name: Node.js ${{ matrix.node }} on ${{ matrix.os }}${{ FULL_TEST && ' (Full Test)' || ''  }}
